website_summaries.verdict: This affordable cooker's design and the included Sunsight make it easy to focus the sun's energy on the cooker at any time of the day.
pros: Cooking area is 12" deep by 17" wide, with no height limit
large enough to cook a small turkey
Included Sunsight makes it easy to focus sunlight on the cooker
Made from Coroplast, a corrugated plastic
cons: Some buyers found the included instructions to be limited

customer_reviews.title: Works in any direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.text: Cooks like a crockpot on sunny winter days. Waiting for summer heat to see how amazing it can be. Must have oven bag or clear pyrex bowls to trap heat.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Never a dry roast.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Boneless beef ribs, 3hr, brownies, 2hr, beef stew, 4hrs all perfect. Con. It wont last forever, I'll have to get another
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brinker

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great. Folds down great
customer_reviews.text: Easier assembly than the original. Cooks great. Folds down great. Can easily carry in backpack. Very durable. Almost indistructable. However cook with less water than recipe ask for. About half or 3/4. Takes a little practice. I suggest trying alot of recipes and writing down adjustments you made. Ie, water amount and time in full sun and part sun ect. But, this is the best one for the dollar. This cooker or two of them and maybe a solar grill would complement eachother. Also, it almost weighs nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight, yet sturdy, packable, efficient, solar cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, yes, corrugated plastic but truly, it's the perfect material because it is quite sturdy, versatile and light weight. I can tell that much thought was put into the design for ease of use and solar effectiveness. When assembling, I didn't have any trouble except that the instructions were a bit scattered but eventually understandable. I have not been able to cook in it yet but will leave a more detailed review when the sun decides to return to the midwest!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, spend the money on a better unit.
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap, thought it would be good for portability, but its clean it won't hold up to being assembled more than a couple of times. Really more like a 1-2 use disposable option. Complicated to assemble. Don't waste your money. Only returnable for 30 days, because they know it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: John Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Shame- total waste
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use. Wanted it to work. Just Mylar covered plastic poster board. Bought pans as recommended. 3 hours in direct Florida Summer sun, couldn’t make water steam. Dissapointment after disappointment. No better than placing a dark pan on a side walk.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I live in San Diego and got it in July. It has not gotten above 150 degrees yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooked dinner on a cold windy day.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I'm very pleased. I have 1 solar oven and have cooked in several of them. I love them, They don't heat up your house and they use no energy or fuel except the free heat from the sun. I love the way this All Season solar cooker is adjustable to all times of day and all seasons. If you buy it and use it I believe you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: All Seasons purchase review!
customer_reviews.text: Solar cooker does exactly as described. One note of suggestion. When purchasing your Pyrex 4 quart mixing bowls for your cooking chamber, only purchase the Pyrex brand as the Anchor Hocking ones will not work. They are too small for the roaster pan to fit it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: be patient
customer_reviews.text: you need hours of patience and a strong sun to obtain some cooking
customer_reviews.author: J. Moragrega

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: Well I've had it for a few months now and I've used it two times it really works I was amazed we had a 40 degree day hi in the late afternoon was about 50 degrees but the Sun was shining bright and it cooked a loaf of bread I was amazed I'm not sure of the durability of the products yet I will put it to the test in the future and hopefully we can get a couple years you said of it I can't frequently and it's going to be in my Camp box for sure
customer_reviews.author: David Beebe

customer_reviews.title: Made from election poster material.
customer_reviews.text: No idea yet. Bought during winter. Buying something sturdier later.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Adams

customer_reviews.title: 140 degrees does'nt cook food !
customer_reviews.text: NEVER GETS HOT ENUFF TO COOK ANYTHING, WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: officermcbride

customer_reviews.title: Take advantage of the HEAT
customer_reviews.text: We cook outside in the summer to keep our home cooler. This is great!! You do need to read and follow the instructions to put it together though!! Ours works great
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: An essential survival tool
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should have this or something similar. Great preparedness tool or if you just enjoy cooking without using electricity or fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will they again
customer_reviews.text: No matter how much I pointed the sun dial the cooker didn't warm up enough to make rice maybe I need practice in how to use it the only thing that got baked was me out in the sun all day.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth E Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy an excellent quality. Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. It cooks better than I ever could’ve imagined. I have been using it every day the sun is out. Cooks rice and beans in three hours. Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for buck, cooks a 2-lb roast in 5 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ability to do roasts and such at up to 230 degrees F. Not as easy to break down as I'd like. Has to be rotated with the sun despite claims of manufacturer, at least twice in a day to get best solar concentration.
customer_reviews.author: wondershovel

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried it out yet but looks like it would be fun to try out. Keep in mind this is not metal. It is more of a sturdy vehicle sun visor type material with a metal rack to put a cooking pan on.
customer_reviews.author: Kingazon

customer_reviews.title: this is for use outdoors only!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an easy time putting this coojer together and find it durable and well made.the inventor makes sure additions are made as needed,ie: a user suggested a change and bingo,thay turned into an idea that became part of the unit.! happy outdoor cooking year round.
customer_reviews.author: Emery

customer_reviews.title: Easy and functional!
customer_reviews.text: This foldable bit of panel is amazing. Cooked chicken and a pork loin in a few hours without using electricity and it was incredibly juicy and tender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solar oven
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Suggest one buys the specialized cook ware the manual suggests. Great seller. Natural disasters prep, or just no power cooking. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick, S California

customer_reviews.title: Quickly pays for itself with free, clean energy!
customer_reviews.text: received afternoon so only had a couple hours of hot sun but even with no plastic bag or glass bowl (wind shield) it heated to 170°. We love this amazingly powerful, lightweight, portable product.
customer_reviews.author: GaysAgainstAbortion

customer_reviews.title: Solar oven
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with how easy this was to assemble. Look forward to using it in the spring or summer.
customer_reviews.author: crpdc

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker
customer_reviews.text: This was my first solar cooker and it was so fun and easy to use. It was a big hit at our last camping trip and the meatballs I made turned out fantastic. It gets quite hot so handle your cookware with oven mitts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great product.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a wonderful addition to our collection of cooking methods at our off-grid finca. It was easy to assemble and set up IF YOU FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS and cooks beautiful casserols and roasts. It is so light to move around so we can set it up pretty much anywhere. Cooked a whole chicken in it while we worked on the garden today. Great not to have to heat up the house but still sit down to a wholesome meal. Well done gor a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Minnimoo

product_meta.title: All Season Solar Cooker (17.0)
feature_bullets: Captures sunlight from sunup to sundown
Folds compactly for transportation or storage
Thousands in use around the world

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars81 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
